Probability-adjusted NPV incorporates the likelihood that certain events will occur when valuing uncertain future cash flows. It is particularly useful in scenarios where outcomes depend heavily on probabilities—such as drug development timelines, regulatory approvals, or clinical success rates.

To compute probability-adjusted NPV:
$$ \text{NPV} = \sum_{t=1}^{n} \frac{\text{Cash Flow}_t}{(1 + r)^t} \times P_t $$
